## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

## Including Plots

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library("dplyr")
library("arules")
library("arulesViz")
library("plotly")
```
```{r}
supermarket <- read_csv("supermarket.csv")
```
#Mencari 6 data teratas
```{r}
head(supermarket)
```
#menampilkan tipe dan struktur data pada supermarket
```{r}
glimpse(supermarket)
```
#menamiplkan deskripsi data
```{r}
summary(supermarket)
```
#Exploratory Analysis
#Barang yang paling sering dibeli pelanggan

```{r}
supermarket %>%
  count(name,name = "banyak barang",sort = TRUE)
```
#barang yang dibeli setiap transaksi
```{r}
supermarket %>%
  select(name,TID)
```
#Pertama membuat rules
```{r}
supermarket_R <- split(supermarket$name,supermarket$TID)
head(supermarket_R, 3)
```
#mengubah dataset menjadi format transactions menggunakan fungsi as()
```{r}
supermarket_transaksi <- as (supermarket_R,"transactions")
supermarket_transaksi %>%
  head(3)%>%
  inspect()
```
#membuat rules menggunakan fungsi apriori, anda bisa mengatur parameter supp, dan conf untuk mendapatkan rules yang anda inginkan
```{r}
Supermarket_rules <- apriori(data = supermarket_transaksi,parameter = list(supp=0.01, conf = 0.1))
```

```{r}
plot(Supermarket_rules,
     method = "graph",
     measure ="lift",
     engine ="htmlwidget" #membuat grafik interaktif
)
```
